question.text: Which of the following combinations is required for chemiosmosis?

options.text: proton pump, electron gradient, NADP synthase
membrane, proton pump, proton gradient, ATP synthase
membrane, proton pump, proton gradient, NADP synthase
proton pump, electron gradient, ATP synthase

solution.text:
ATP synthesis according to chemiosmosis hypothesis takes place in both chloroplasts (photophosphorylation) and mitochondria (oxidative phosphorylation). Both these processes need the involvement of:

  • A membrane (thylakoid membrane or mitochondrial membrane, respectively).
  • Proton pumps to maintain the pH.
  • Proton gradient to move the proton across the membrane.
  • ATP synthase enzyme which is present in F0-F1 particles in mitochondria or CF0-CF1 particles in plastids.
